title: Calories in Mussels
meta_description: Discover calories in mussels per 100g serving, including protein, fat, carbs, and full nutrition breakdown for easy meal planning.
assumptions: Cooked (steamed or boiled), shelled edible portion, no added fats, sauces, or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by species, freshness, cooking method, and portion size. Check labels or sources for specifics.

quick_answer.text: 100g of cooked mussels provide ~172 kcal and ~24g protein.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged products.

tweaks.label: With white wine sauce (1 tbsp per 100g)

faqs.q: How many calories in 100g of mussels?
faqs.a: About 172 kcal for cooked, shelled mussels.
Yes, 100g provides ~24g protein, making them a lean seafood option.
They contain ~7.4g carbs per 100g, mostly from natural glycogen.

faqs.q: What's the fat content in mussels?
faqs.a: Around 4.5g total fat per 100g, with low saturated fat at 0.9g.

faqs.q: How does cooking affect calories in mussels?
faqs.a: Cooking concentrates nutrients; raw mussels have about half the calories per 100g.
